Field Summary
static int DEV
          for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version

Field Detail

DEV

public static final int DEV
for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version

FOUR_HOURS

public static final int FOUR_HOURS
should always have a timeout... should NOT let something run forever

public java.lang.String uniqueNameFromBase(java.lang.String base)

exec

public abstract boolean exec(ConsoleManager cm,
                             java.lang.String ctx_str,
                             java.lang.String cmd,
                             int timeout_sec,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                             byte[] stdin_post,
                             java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                             java.lang.String current_dir)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                             java.lang.Exception
executes the given program

Parameters:
cm -
ctx_str -
cmd - - program to run
timeout_sec - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
env - - map of environment variables to use
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
current_dir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FOUR_HOURS

exec

public abstract boolean exec(ConsoleManager cm,
                             java.lang.String ctx_str,
                             java.lang.String commandline,
                             int timeout,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                             byte[] stdin,
                             java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                             java.lang.String chdir,
                             AbstractTestPackRunner.TestPackRunnerThread thread,
                             int thread_slow_sec)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
executes the given program. if thread_slow_sec time is exceeded, calls TestPackRunnerThread#slowTest so that the TestPackRunner can compensate

commandline -
timeout -
env -
stdin -
charset -

thread -
thread_slow_sec -

removeFileExt

public static java.lang.String removeFileExt(java.lang.String path)
removes the file extension from file. for filenames like A.B returns A for all others (if . not found), path if path is a relative or absolute path (if path has directory|ies), the directories are not removed just .BBB

Parameters:
path -
Returns:

dirSeparator

public abstract java.lang.String dirSeparator()
returns the character to separate directories within one path On Windows this is \\ On Linux this is / Note: on Windows, if #exec or #cmd not being used, then / can still be used

isWindows

public abstract boolean isWindows()
returns TRUE if host is Windows this is a fast method which caches its values, so you don't have to do that in your code generally if !isWindows == isPosix

Returns:

isVistaOrBefore(), isVistaExact(), isWin8OrLater()

countUp

public static int countUp(java.lang.String from,
                          java.lang.String to)
counts the number of parent directories from from to to (its parent, parent of its parent, etc...) countUp('a/b/c', 'a') => 2

Parameters:
from -
to -
Returns:

pathFrom

public static java.lang.String pathFrom(java.lang.String from,
                                        java.lang.String to)
returns part of path separating to from from. ex: pathFrom(/a/b, /a/b/c/d) => /c/d

Parameters:
from -
to -
